name: Black Knight
blockquote: The Black Knights are the loyal servants of Messmer the Impaler. They don black iron helms decorated with gold and chest plates with golden Scadutree engravings, a small consolation for those forced into a graceless and dishonorable war. They emanate a rotten odor, possibly from the tainted blood splattered upon them, or from their own corrupted souls, decaying from endless slaughter.

name: Bigmouth Imp
blockquote: Bigmouth Imps infest many of the catacombs in the Lands of Shadow. These creatures are adept at causing disturbances, moving nimbly like pests, and lurking around corners, ready to attack any trespassers who dare to enter their catacombs.

name: Jar Innards
blockquote: For pity's sake, your place is in the jar. Nigh-sainthood itself awaits you within. For shamans like you, this is your lot. Life were you accorded for this alone." - Phantom in Bonny Village

name: Curseblade
blockquote: These entities wield the Curseblade's Cirque in both hands, a backhand blade with wave-like cutting edges, sharpened into points that incite blood loss. Long ago, this was employed by the ascetics who strove to become tutelary deities as a ritualistic object in their self-flagellating dances. Their movements are almost dance-like, blending both elegance and lethality as they deliver their attacks. Their flashy combat style will leave their opponents disoriented and overwhelmed.

name: Golem Smith
blockquote: These imposing constructs can be seen roaming around the ancient forges. They carry pots of lava on their heads, which they can hurl as projectiles. Their ability to withstand most attacks makes them very difficult to deal with. These beings also have a weakness, a red gem embedded in their backs can be seen and striking this weak spot can inflict critical damage.

name: Gravebird
blockquote: Gravebirds are imposing ancient golems crafted to resemble their kin, the Deathbirds. These creatures soar through the air with stone wings and spout ghostflame. According to legend, Gravebirds were created to be kindred spirits to the Deathbirds, sharing a mysterious and sinister origin. Their primary purpose is to guard spiritgraves, the sacred resting places built to collect and contain the souls of all who have met their end.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Common enemy that can be found in the overworld.

name: Shadowpot
blockquote: Elusive shadow figures that carry pots over their heads. When confronted, they tend to flee. They are worth the effort to catch as defeating them often yields valuable materials or items.

name: Shadow Undead
blockquote: These undead beings have their lost souls cursed to roam eternally, with their minds consumed by the curse, retaining only a fragment of their former selves. Some retain faint echoes of their past lives, occasionally displaying fleeting moments of hesitation or sorrow.

name: Spider Scorpion
blockquote: Spider Scorpions blend the traits of both spiders and scorpions. These monstrous beings attack with powerful pincers and a venomous tail, delivering lethal blows to those who dare approach. Originally, this breed of scorpion was native to the realm of shadow and was significantly smaller in size. However, the recent emergence of these gigantic Spider Scorpions has been traced back to the Church of the Bud.

name: Man-Fly
blockquote: These creatures were originally humans who suffered from a metamorphosing illness, transforming them into human-insect hybrids. The disease ravaged their peaceful villages, killing most of the population. The few who survived were turned into man-flies. The illness also appears to make the infected aggressive, causing them to attack on sight.

name: Horned Warrior
blockquote: A fearsome adversary, easily recognizable by their distinctive appearance. Their helms feature a crown of sturdy tangled horns, allowing them to invoke divinity. Clad in plated armor and adorned with ochre fabric. These warriors are not only resilient, but also agile, as they combine brute strength with swift and deadly precision.

name: Fire Knight
blockquote: Adorned in a pointed helm and armor featuring a red cape and twin golden snakes around the neck that enhances Messmer's flame incantations, each knight hails from a renowned family of the Erdtree's upper echelons. However, they were shunned and exiled from their homes after swearing loyalty to Messmer as their master.

name: Aging Untouchable
blockquote: "I touched him, but only once. When he thrust his staff in my face, I brushed it aside. It was then that I touched him. The aging untouchable."

name: Bloodfiend
blockquote: These creatures have towering figures, but their bodies are grotesquely transformed. Despite their terrifying appearance, they exhibit a strange behavior. They patrol their designated areas as if they're driven by a forgotten purpose.

name: Hippopotamus
blockquote: These formidable beasts are reminiscent of the majestic Golden Hippopotamus, but lack the divine erdtree incantations that their golden counterparts possess. Instead, they rely solely on brute strength and aggressive nature to overpower their opponents.

name: Blue Worm
blockquote: These creatures can easily be seen, with their sapphire-hued bodies protruding from the ground. They are harmless when left undisturbed.

name: Giant Beast Skeleton
blockquote: These skeletal guardians are relentless in their patrols, being at the ready for intruders who dare trespass their domains.

name: Living Magma
blockquote: These blazing entities embody the raw, untamed power of fire itself.

name: Inquisitor
blockquote: These mages stand vigilant within the dimly lit catacombs of the Lands of Shadow.

name: Divine Bird Warrior
blockquote: They are the very first of all horned warriors, donning helms of entwined horns and divine bird masks that enable the wearer to invoke divinity. Their armor, greaves, and gauntlets are crafted from golden metal. It is said that the golden-hued divine birds are known to be cruel, shunning human companionship. Few have ever succeeded in invoking their divine power.

name: Messmer Soldier
blockquote: Loyal soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. These warriors don iron helms with visors. Their foreheads bear a Scadutree design etched in gold. They are clad in rusted chainmail covered by a ragged cloak, and their chestpieces also feature the Scadutree motif, also engraved with gold.

name: Shadow Militiamen
blockquote: These small and agile warriors found their place amid the darkened ruins and cursed Lands of Shadow.

name: Messmer Foot Soldier
blockquote: Base level soldiers, devoted followers of Messmer the Impaler.

name: Horned Shaman
blockquote: These shamans remain stationary, cloaked in golden robes and giant horns protruding from their heads, with long white hair cascading down their backs. Their gaze spans great distances, ensuring that no one can approach unnoticed. They strike from afar, unleashing powerful spells upon any who dare intrude on the sacred grounds of Enir-Ilim.

name: Demi-Human Swordmaster
blockquote: These small but formidable creatures are adept swordsmen, moving with nimble agility and striking their opponents with speed and precision. They can swiftly approach their opponents from behind to catch them off guard.

name: Putrescence Sorcerer
blockquote: These malevolent mages cloaked in robes that reek of decay stand silently within their posts, ready to cast death sorceries upon intruders.

name: Shadow Commoner
blockquote: Haunting figures found throughout the Lands of Shadow. Unlike their aggressive counterparts, these beings are often seen in a state of series stillness, either kneeling in silent prayer or just standing around in corners, lost in their own thoughts.

name: Warhawk
blockquote: Stormhawks that have had their talons sliced off, so that razor-fine swords could be grafted in their place. They react with extreme aggression, using their mobility in combination with their deadly talons.

drops: 56 - 1039 Runes Warhawk's Talon Flight Pinion Stormhawk Feather
56 - 1039 Runes Warhawk's Talon Flight Pinion Stormhawk Feather
56 - 1039 Runes Warhawk's Talon Flight Pinion Stormhawk Feather
56 - 1039 Runes Warhawk's Talon Flight Pinion Stormhawk Feather
56 - 1039 Runes Warhawk's Talon Flight Pinion Stormhawk Feather

name: Boar
blockquote: The Boars of Limgrave are less aggressive than normal, but should not be assumed to be passive

name: Crab
blockquote: Only those of comfort and means know the truth: a crab's eggs are more delectable than its meat.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Found near bodies of water in the Lands Between.
drops: 10 - 839 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
10 - 839 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
10 - 839 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
10 - 839 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
10 - 839 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh

name: Deer
blockquote: Deer roam freely in the plains on Limgrave, now that hunters have all but disappeared

drops: 4 - 27 Runes Thin Animal Bones Sliver of Meat Beast Liver Budding Horn Beast Horn Empyrean-Blood Burgeon Dragon's Calorbloom Nectarblood Burgeon Spirit Calculus

LocationsAndDrops.location: South West Liurnia of The Lakes
drops: 4 - 27 Runes Thin Animal Bones Sliver of Meat Beast Liver Budding Horn Beast Horn Empyrean-Blood Burgeon Dragon's Calorbloom Nectarblood Burgeon Spirit Calculus
52 - 1390 Runes Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood
52 - 1390 Runes Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood
52 - 1390 Runes Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood
52 - 1390 Runes Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood
52 - 1390 Runes Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood

LocationsAndDrops.location: Near swampy areas in the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

name: Putrid Corpse
blockquote: Their movements are dull and confused... True death does not come easily for them.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Found anywhere near water in the Lands Between
drops: 318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh
318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh

name: Owl
blockquote: Nocturnal creatures, owls can often be seen perched on cliffsides, looking for preys.

LocationsAndDrops.location: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow
drops: 4 - 16 Runes Slumbering Egg Beast Horn Nectarblood Burgeon Spirit Calculus

name: Miranda Sprout
blockquote: Sweet little carnivorous blossoms that feed upon human flesh. They creep slowly, scattering toxic pollen. They are vulnerable to fire.

name: Land Squirt
blockquote: The firm, fleshy tubes of the creatures remain rooted to the spot, spraying poisonous liquid over their surroundings.

name: Giant Rat
blockquote: [They] swarm upon their victims... These vermin seem to multiply incessantly.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

name: Sheep
blockquote: The wild sheep of the Lands Between have been roaming the wilds ever since The Shattering. They are timid and will often run away when spotted, with some even balling up and rolling away.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Pastures throughout The Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

drops: 16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone
16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone

name: Spirit Jellyfish
blockquote: Ethereal beings usually found near places of rest, acting as protectors. They are usually peaceful, but if angered, they attack with deadly poison fired from a distance.

drops: 14 - 569 Runes Grave Gloveworts Golden Rune [3] Trina's Lily

name: Turtle
blockquote: Turtles are known as a nutritious ingredient, symbolic of inexhaustible power. However, those who hold turtles to be wise creatures consider the practice of eating their meat to be barbarous.

name: Lone Wolf
blockquote: Lone Wolves roam the Lands Between in packs, overwhelming targets with their agility

name: Stray
blockquote: ...Stray dog. ...Though it is only a small creature, it is as violent as it is nimble.

LocationsAndDrops.location: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow
drops: 52 - 1829 Runes Ruin Fragment Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood Sanctuary Stone Sacramental Bud

name: Bloody Finger Nerijus
blockquote: If it isn't Nerijus, The Bloody Finger. The end is nigh. For you, and your cessblood. - Yura

LocationsAndDrops.location: Invades on the ravine leading north-east from Agheel Lake, toward Murkwater Catacombs

name: Exile Soldier
blockquote: ...Soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

drops: Crescent Moon Axe Soldier's Crossbow Smithing Stones Stormhawk Feather Smoldering Butterfly Mushroom
Crescent Moon Axe Soldier's Crossbow Smithing Stones Stormhawk Feather Smoldering Butterfly Mushroom
Crescent Moon Axe Soldier's Crossbow Smithing Stones Stormhawk Feather Smoldering Butterfly Mushroom

name: Demi-Human
blockquote: Demi-Humans are small in stature, but they have a violent, brutish disposition. Though they seem somewhat intelligent, when night falls, their blood boils and they become feral.

drops: 844 - 3927 Runes Golem's Halberd Golem Greatbow Great Arrow Golem's Great Arrow Golem's Magic Arrow Smithing Stones
844 - 3927 Runes Golem's Halberd Golem Greatbow Great Arrow Golem's Great Arrow Golem's Magic Arrow Smithing Stones
844 - 3927 Runes Golem's Halberd Golem Greatbow Great Arrow Golem's Great Arrow Golem's Magic Arrow Smithing Stones
844 - 3927 Runes Golem's Halberd Golem Greatbow Great Arrow Golem's Great Arrow Golem's Magic Arrow Smithing Stones
844 - 3927 Runes Golem's Halberd Golem Greatbow Great Arrow Golem's Great Arrow Golem's Magic Arrow Smithing Stones

name: Imp
blockquote: These spirits are well suited to causing a disturbance, moving nimbly like pests and hurling magic pots.

LocationsAndDrops.location: The rooftops of Leyndell Royal Capital
The pipes of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds

name: Troll
blockquote: The lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago. Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shapeâ€”such that the gold plating had flaked away.

name: Kaiden Sellsword
blockquote: These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

drops: Rowa Raisin Sweet Raisin Frozen Raisin
Rowa Raisin Sweet Raisin Frozen Raisin
Rowa Raisin Sweet Raisin Frozen Raisin

name: Godrick Soldier
blockquote: The soldiers who serve Godrick the Grafted are what remains of the army that fled the royal capital of the Erdtree.

name: Skeletal Militiaman
blockquote: Militiamen who live in Death, and will continue to rise again until properly finished off. This is the grotesque fate of those who come into contact with Deathroot.

LocationsAndDrops.location: In the beaches and graveyards of the Lands Between

name: Skeletal Bandit
blockquote: The remains of former bandits that will continue to rise again until properly finished off. After the night of the plot, Deathroot appeared in the Lands Between, and Those Who Live in Death soon followed.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Dungeons and graveyards of the Lands Between
drops: Bandit's Curved Sword Human Bone Shard

LocationsAndDrops.location: Typically found in graveyards across the Lands Between

name: Living Jar
blockquote: Though the jars are brought to life by human flesh and blood, they are all rather kindly folk. Perhaps they were made to be better than their innards. Their fragments command a high price due to the magical power locked within. This leaves the living jars unfortunate targets for poachers.

name: Lesser Alabaster Lord
blockquote: A race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

name: Misbegotten
blockquote: The misbegotten are held to be a punishment for making contact with the Crucible, and from birth they are treated as slaves, or worse.

name: Wandering Nobles
blockquote: Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead beings are the pitiful product of unending life. They are most commonly found struggling to maintain balance while roaming the fields of The Lands Between. Surely they were in search of something once - but whatever it was has long been forgotten.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Near or around ruins that have fallen from the sky

name: Noble Sorcerer
blockquote: Noble Sorcerers are frail old men wearing tattered garbs and a dirty yellow cape. They use a standard glintstone staff as both a sorcery catalyst and walking stick.

name: School of Graven Mages
blockquote: The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Various Towers across The Lands Between

name: Recusant Henricus
blockquote: An invader serving the Volcano Manor, tasked with hunting down fellow Tarnished. His large mace can make quick of any unfortunate targets.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Found near Evergaols, cemeteries, and specific points of interest.

name: Wild Mouflon
blockquote: Wild Mouflons become hostile when threatened and fight their aggressors by charging forward and striking them with their large horns.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Open field areas, forests, and caves

name: Commoner
blockquote: The boards that hang from their necks depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. A self imposed shackle, that displayed their allegiance to the Erdtree. ...Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

name: Banished Knight
blockquote: Many knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

name: Flame Chariot
blockquote: Beware the Fire Monks' chariots bearing the faces of giants. - Note: Flame Chariots

name: Fire Monk
blockquote: The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The monks came to the land of Liurnia in pursuit of a fugitive who stole their fire.

name: Leyndell Knight
blockquote: Knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The golden canopy atop their helmets represent the honor of standing among the tree's defenders.

name: Marionette Soldier
blockquote: Marionette soldiers were created to serve a sorcerer. On the verge of falling apart, they are illâ€”disciplined and attack without warning.

name: Glintstone Sorcerer
blockquote: Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars

name: Lazuli Sorcerer
blockquote: Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries - a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.

name: Twinsage Sorcerer
blockquote: Raya Lucaria sorcerers who wear a stone crown. T hose who study the Twinsage Conspectus are the academy's elite, capable of mastering the Glintstone Cometshard and Crystal Burst sorcereries.

name: Ancestral Follower
blockquote: Horned folk who eschew letters and metalworking. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

name: Clayman
blockquote: The warped remains of priests who searched for revelation in service of the ancient dynasty, they employ two sorceries that produce smaller and larger bubbles.

name: Vulgar Militiamen
blockquote: In the Lands Between, the small were scorned, and so they formed their vulgar militia as a means to make a living, albeit in ignominy. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

name: Silver Tear
blockquote: The Silver Tear makes mockery of life, reborn again and again into imitation. Perhaps, one day, it will be reborn a lord...

name: Fallen Hawks Soldier
blockquote: When the band's last embers were used up in their long search, they began to burn the bones of their fellows, acquiring the cold ghostflame, but sealing their fate as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.

name: Nox Swordstress
blockquote: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Baleful Shadow
blockquote: I turned my back on the Two Fingers and we each have been cursing the other since. The Baleful Shadows... are their assassins. - Miniature Ranni

name: Mausoleum Knight
blockquote: A self-inflicted curse ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.

name: Highwayman
blockquote: Former foot soldiers who have since turned to banditry. They ambush any who approach, wishing to take their valuables for themselves.

name: Azula Beastman
blockquote: Beastmen from doomed Farum Azula, the slowly crumbling ruins in the skies. These ruins are said to be the remains of a giant mausoleum enshrining an ancient dragon, guarded by chosen beastmen who wield weapons clad in lightning.

name: Farum Azula Dragon
blockquote: Ancestors of the modern dragons, the ancient dragons had scales of Gravel Stone and wielded lightning as their weapon. It is said that they once attacked Leyndell, the Royal Capital. Spoken of in legend, red lightning is the weapon wielded by the ancient dragons.

drops: Ancient Dragon Smithing Stone (Greater Farum Azula Dragons only) Gravel Stone x3 (respawning Lesser Farum Azula Dragon only) Runes (32,400, 21,600, or 14,400 depending on type)

name: Lesser Red Wolf of Radagon
blockquote: Extremely large wolves with scarlet fur, often found as the alpha of their pack. It is capable of casting Magic Glintblades, using them along with their blistering speed.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Liurnia of The Lakes Consecrated Snowfield Nokron, Eternal City

name: Mausoleum Soldier
blockquote: ...Soldiers who confound foes by disappearing and reappearing at will. The mausoleum is where the bodies of soulless demigods are lain to rest, and these soldiers followed their masters into Death by severing their own heads from their bodies.

name: Battlemage
blockquote: Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape. Scholars of the Haima Conspectus sought the power to quell conflict, and to this end studied the sorceries of cannon fire and the gavel.

name: Celebrant
blockquote: Dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

name: Crystal Snail
blockquote: Snails with crystals growing from their shell. Normally found curled up within their shells blending in to their surroundings, will attack if provoked.

name: Glintstone Miner
blockquote: The ever-working miners of the tunnels, tasked with harvesting crystals from deep beneath. Their staff allows them to summon a drill to shatter rock and enemies alike.

name: Avionette Soldier
blockquote: Marionette soldiers with avian features that were created to serve a sorcerer. Equipped with long-hafted scythes and swords, they also attack from the skies by lobbing fire pots. Can sometimes malfunction when damaged

name: Albinauric
blockquote: Albinaurics are lifeforms made by human hands. Thus, many believe them to live impure lives, untouched by the Erdtree's grace.

name: Revenant
blockquote: A grotesque amalgamation of limbs, the Revenant is a creature with the body structure of an arachnid and the face of a human. Much like a spider, it possesses many limbs that seem to have been grafted onto its body, taken from diseased humans. The Revenant is capable of traveling through portals it creates with a peculiar form of magic, swiftly emerging behind a foe to catch them off guard.

name: Lesser Mad Pumpkin Head
blockquote: Though he has stifled his panic within the dark confines of his helmet, he rampages as if driven mad when agitated by bloodshed or the humming of insects. This mad soldier is all that is left of a broken gladiator.

name: Perfumer
blockquote: In time past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives

name: Blackflame Monk
blockquote: The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Guardian's Garrison , in Mountaintops of the Giants

name: Great Horned Tragoth
blockquote: Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

name: Guardian
blockquote: In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that  their deaths lead not to destruction, but instead to renewed. eternal life as guardians.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between

name: Lesser Black Knife Assassin
blockquote: The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

name: Page
blockquote: ...Pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. Uses a piercing sword and crossbow to defend [their] master.

name: Lesser Bloodhound Knight
blockquote: The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

name: Moongrum, Carian Knight
blockquote: The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, their power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle

name: Lesser Kindred of Rot (Pests)
blockquote: Pale pests who crawl through the lands afflicted by scarlet rot; the abandoned children of the goddess. "Rot for the scarlet goddess. O scarlet blossoms, flourish in distant lands, and return to us, the unwanted children."

name: Raya Lucaria Foot Soldier
blockquote: Foot Soldiers usually guarding camps and ruins with their fellow Soldiers, they wander around the Raya Lucaria Academy located within Liurnia of the Lakes.

name: Leyndell Foot Soldier
blockquote: ...Foot Soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.

name: Radahn Foot Soldier
blockquote: Base level soldiers, serving General Radahn's army.

name: Mausoleum Foot Soldier
blockquote: ...Headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

name: Haligtree Foot Soldier
blockquote: ...Common soldiers who carry the sacred light. When weakened, they explode to deliver a last-ditch attack. This was the bitter revelation discovered by the desperate soldiers who awaited the return of their lord to the rotted Haligtree. May the flash of our deaths guide Miquella's return.

name: Starcaller
blockquote: Scavengers desperately digging around craters found in the wake of meteorite strikes, they dub themselves Starcallers.

name: Thorn Sorcerer
blockquote: The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.

name: Oracle Envoy
blockquote: Monstrous band of musicians who employ sacred arts. It is said that when Oracle Envoys appear playing their pipes, they do so to herald the arrival of a new god, or age.

name: Putrid Corpse
blockquote: Their movements are dull and confused... True death does not come easily for them.

name: Haligtree Knight
blockquote: Knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. They are skilled in using both magical and holy skills, loyally protecting the rotted Haligtree to the very end.

name: Haligtree Soldier
blockquote: Loyal Soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. While rather unimpressive on their own, they are often found in large groups, using numbers to their advantage.

name: Leyndell Soldier
blockquote: The soldiers of Leyndell fight their battles defensively. During the Shattering, they were the ramparts that fortified the royal capital.

name: Radahn Soldier
blockquote: General Radahn's soldiers were all reputed to be masterful warriors, and it was popularly said that the Redmanes knew no weakness.

name: Redmane Knight
blockquote: Knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Their red plumes is a symbol of Radahn's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son - the mane of the proud Red Lion.

name: Albinauric Archer
blockquote: These warrior Albinaurics have weak legs, which makes them unable to walk. Thus, they rely on their archery to take down opponents. Those found riding Direwolves are a force to be reckoned with.

name: Ancestral Follower Shaman
blockquote: The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

name: Cuckoo Knight
blockquote: Knights, named for the cuckoo feather on their helmets, who faithfully serve the Academy of Raya Lucaria, and were given free rein to wage war as they please. Like their masters, they use various sorceries for combat, but they are more skilled in melee combat.

name: Depraved Perfumer
blockquote: These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

name: Duelist
blockquote: Former gladitorial fighters who were exiled from the colloseum. They wield chain axes and hammers, and attack with a frenzied fervor.

name: Edgar the Revenger
blockquote: ...Ahh the poor fellow... Gone perfectly mad. Love... Revenge....the frenzied flame melts it all away... - Spirit

LocationsAndDrops.location: Revenger's Shack , Liurnia of the Lakes

name: Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm
blockquote: A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

name: Fire Prelate
blockquote: The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

LocationsAndDrops.location: near entrance of Giants' Mountaintop Catacombs

name: High Page
blockquote: Strong and dexterous servants of the Nobility, commited to keep them out of harm's way. Specially compared with their common counterparts.

name: Inquisitor Ghiza
blockquote: A menacing agent of the Volcano Manor, wielding a colossal weapon of torture.

name: Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood
blockquote: Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers. His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

name: Knight of Zamor
blockquote: These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

name: Lesser Burial Watchdog
blockquote: The Watchdogs, battered and broken over their lengthy tenure, rule the catacombs and are even said to command the imps

LocationsAndDrops.location: Caria Manor Liurnia of the Lakes

name: Mad Tongue Alberich
blockquote: Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

name: Maleigh Marais, Shaded Castle Castellan
blockquote: The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

LocationsAndDrops.location: Fields west of The Shaded Castle

name: Man-Serpent
blockquote: It is said that long ago, the elder serpent that dwelled on Mt. Gelmir devoured a demigod, and the birth of the man-serpents followed.

name: Nameless White Mask
blockquote: Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varre, that is; but he was an exception.

name: Night Maiden
blockquote: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Nomad
blockquote: A member of a tribe that was entombed in the earth so as to bury the maddening disease that followed them. Able to emit the terrible flame of frenzy from his eyes, but has low HP and is frail, unable to take much in the way of punishment.

name: Nox Monk
blockquote: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Nox Swordstress
blockquote: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Old Knight Istvan
blockquote: Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

name: Preceptor Miriam
blockquote: One of the magic preceptors that served the Carian royals

name: Raya Lucaria Soldier
blockquote: The soldiers of Raya Lucaria were also known as the Cuckoos. They were given free rein by the academy to wage war as they pleased, and they were infamous for their rapacious ways.

name: Rileigh the Idle
blockquote: There was a time when Tarnished who had strayed from guidance feared nothing more than utter silence.

name: Troll Knight
blockquote: Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.

name: Vargram the Raging Wolf
blockquote: One of the first Tarnished to arrive at the Roundtable, Vargram was named after the white wolf pelt on his helm. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

name: Lesser Crystalian
blockquote: The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

name: Lesser Cemetery Shade
blockquote: Insect-ridden grave keepers.

name: Lesser Dragon
blockquote: The dragons that escaped the scarlet rot and made nest of the plateau to Caelid's north. Thus it was named "Dragonbarrow," and none dare to enter.

name: Lesser Cleanrot Knight
blockquote: The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

drops: Furlcalling Finger Remedy Rune Arc Great Stars Somber Smithing Stone (6)
